message_1:
Consider the Laplace transform of the function $f(t) = te^{\frac{t}{2}}$. Find the Laplace transform of $f(t)$ with respect to $s$ using the definition of Laplace transform:

$$F(s) = \int_0^\infty e^{-st} f(t) dt$$
message_2:
To find the Laplace transform of $f(t) = te^{\frac{t}{2}}$, we will use the definition of Laplace transform:

$$F(s) = \int_0^\infty e^{-st} f(t) dt$$

Substitute the given function $f(t)$ into the integral:

$$F(s) = \int_0^\infty e^{-st} te^{\frac{t}{2}} dt$$

Now, combine the exponentials:

$$F(s) = \int_0^\infty te^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} dt$$

To solve this integral, we will use integration by parts. Let $u = t$ and $dv = e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} dt$. Then, $du = dt$ and $v = \frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t}$.

Applying integration by parts:

$$F(s) = \left[uv\right]_0^\infty - \int_0^\infty v du$$

$$F(s) = \left[\frac{t}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t}\right]_0^\infty - \int_0^\infty \frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} dt$$

Now, evaluate the first term:

$$\lim_{t \to \infty} \frac{t}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} = 0$$ (assuming $s > \frac{1}{2}$ for convergence)

And for the lower limit:

$$\frac{0}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)(0)} = 0$$

So, the first term is 0. Now, we need to evaluate the remaining integral:

$$F(s) = - \int_0^\infty \frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} dt$$

$$F(s) = -\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} \int_0^\infty e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} dt$$

Now, integrate with respect to $t$:

$$F(s) = -\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} \left[\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t}\right]_0^\infty$$

Evaluate the limits:

$$F(s) = -\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} \left(\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} \lim_{t \to \infty} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)t} - \frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} e^{(\frac{1}{2} - s)(0)}\right)$$

$$F(s) = -\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s} \left(0 - \frac{1}{\frac{1}{2} - s}\right)$$

Finally, simplify:

$$F(s) = \frac{1}{(\frac{1}{2} - s)^2}$$

So, the Laplace transform of $f(t) = te^{\frac{t}{2}}$ is:

$$F(s) = \frac{1}{(\frac{1}{2} - s)^2}$$
